text: Hello everyone :wave::skin-tone-2: . New here. We've had an existing HubSpot site dropped onto our lap and been asked to integrate a language switcher into it. I have lots of CMS experience (Drupal), but zero HubSpot experience. What's the best way to get a handle on the situation on a site like this? Is there a quick way of figuring out what customizations are in place? What features are being used? What information would you look for when being handed a site like this?
can you tell if it is a custom developed theme or a marketplace theme?

Hello:wave:! Have you used any email validation tool which is integrated to HubSpot? We're considering to validate contacts who are hard bounced, global bounced, and etc. for all contacts in our CRM. If you happen to know any good tools, please suggest!
IIRC they said private beta in Nov, but I’ll wait for a HubSpotter confirm.
Hi. It's a custom developed theme.

There are a lot of questions here - the first is getting a handle on the situation, which you'll need to do via an audit of the files in Design Tools.

Some things that can help with this are checking revision dates and dependents, so you can see when they were last updated and what content is dependent on what.

If it's a custom theme, then essentially the whole thing is customized, it would be near impossible to compare to anything unless you compare it against the boiler plate.

I hope this helps shed a little light, perhaps others will have more insight to share.
Thank you!
hi my freind

```I want to be the developer of the Arabic language in full and fully responsible for the language and give me all the powers of the developer so that I can build a separate application in the Arabic language with the full and work with you. I am looking for a job and there are many opportunities in the Arab countries for CRM and ERB content```
CALL whatsaap
Is there a way to find the folderid with a file url? I am trying to find a file in the HubSpot file manager but the folder names are not matching the folder paths in the url href. Thank you.
So the only thing you have is a file id?
Hi Carter. The only thing I have is the file path. <https://domain.com/hubfs/folder/folder/file.pdf>
Ah ok, interesting. Are the file names specific enough to use the search endpoint?
one of the folder names isn't exactly what is in the url so wanting make sure I replace the right thing
Yeah definitely but is the file name specific enough that you can just use the search endpoint to find it?
Hey Zezo, in the future, the <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> channel would be the better place to post things like for job searching and posting.
no there are multiple of the same name
so the only thing different is the folder
You could try using the search by path I believe you can use partial paths so the missing parent folder name shouldn't affect it too much
wow how do you find that?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/files/files>
Hahaha just under the search endpoint
You could also try the url param
noob
I was looking at the website
file manager and not the api
Oh yeah, I think the api is going to be your best bet
thank you Carter
what do you use to run api calls like this?
Postman, but you could use the test call button in the corner of the docs
thank you for your time and help
Of course, let me know if you need help running those api calls

Hey Developer community, is there a way to map HubSpot users to an org structure relationship? We send our BI partners a spreadsheet weekly with the names of our sales team and their access level to the BI tools, it would be awesome if I could automate this directly from HubSpot
You could check out orgchart
<https://orgcharthub.com/>
It might not be exactly what you're looking for but it's pretty powerful
thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>! I'll look into it
Do you know if I could send this info out through an API?
I know that they have an internal api but the question is whether you can access that api
CC <@UMGJSMA23> do you guys allow for this?

Oh, hey - erm not a public API, no.

We’ve actually not had the question come up much so we’ve not built one yet. One for the future though if there’s enough interest. Most teams don’t really have the org chart detail they need/want spreadsheets (or third-party systems) so tend to build visually instead.
